TextView.android:text: Request for Local Registration and Verification on Youth and Youth-Serving Organizations

The Local Registration and Verification on Youth and Youth-Serving Organizations is a type of service under the Local Youth Development Office anchored to the Youth Organization Registration Program of National Youth Commission. This service is made to acknowledge, recognize and ensure the participation of the youth in the community, especially to the 10 pillars of youth participation.
3. List of Members in Good Standing
1. Submit the complete requirements for evaluation and validation.
1.1. Receive and review the requirements if complete.
1.2. If qualified, prepare Certificate of Registration and Verification and inform the client for all the benefits a YO or YSO will get, it’s functions and responsibilities, once registered.
1.4. LYDO Staff will send the certificate to MMO for LCE’s signature.
1.5. Back to LYDO for record keeping.
2.1. Photo opportunity for accomplishment report and social media posting. LYDO will issue the signed certificate of registration and verification.
2.2. LYDO will issue the signed certificate of registration and verification
3.1. Request the client to Accomplish the client satisfaction measurement/Client satisfaction survey online.
